array.string: What is OPA?
OPA is a mobile app that allows users to exchange information about public or private spots. It will help facilitate a better community whether that is parking, seating or queuing.
What platforms is the app available?
OPA is currently available on any Android- and iOS-run devices. Our goal is to make it available to as many users as possible.
How do I request a spot?
Simply tap on a pin of the spot you want and send a request.
How do I post a spot?

Press and hold your finger on the map until the "post here" icon appears. Move the map to the desired location and select "post here". Provide the date and time the spot will be available. Set your price. Give any aditional details. Post your spot and wait for someone to send you a request.
What do the different pins mean?
Blue pins with a dollar amount show available spots; a Pink pin is the spot you posted; and, a pin with a car image show you are in agreement.
What kinds of categories of spots are indicated in the app?

The poster of the spot is asked to show whether it is a vehicle, seat, or queue. But it is the responsibility of the user to use the spots legally, such as, by paying extra for the spot, having a permission, or observing the time limits.
How do I get paid?
For now you get paid from the other party in cash. However, we recommend that you post for â‚¬0.
How do I pay?
You pay using cash.
Why feedback?
Feedback measures your value as a customer. The more positive feedback you have the more reliable you are.
Why can I not login?
If you get three negative feedbacks, you are locked out of the OPA system.
Do I pay a commission to OPA?
OPA does not take a commission at this time.
What do I do if I am running late?
Notify the poster via the chat immediately and try to rearrange the timing.
I requested a spot, but never received any response from the poster. What should I do?
Cancel your request and look for another spot on the map.
I'm in another app. Can I still get messages?
No worries, OPA alerts you by push notifications.
